document_title: Stomach polyps: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Stomach polyps can occur in both men and women and at any age, but people aged 45 years and older often face a higher risk. Among them, fundic gland polyps are often found in middle-aged women.(2)
Patients taking proton pump inhibitors to treat gastritis, acid reflux, or other stomach problems may be at higher risk of developing stomach polyps.
The presence of H. pylori bacteria in a patient's stomach can also increase the risk of stomach polyps. All patients should be tested for active H. pylori infection; If present, the infection should be treated.
In addition, people who have a habit of smoking, do not exercise, etc. are susceptible to stomach polyps.
